todos.title: FAKE IT TILL YOU MAKE IT
todos.body: You can always change the name or buy the domain at a later date.

todos.title: LITERAL V. EVOCATIVE
todos.body: Tvguide.com v. Yahoo.com.  * Evocative names make it harder to break into the market but defend your brand better.

todos.title: WHITEBOARD
todos.body: Throw all names on a whiteboard and see which ones stick.  Sleep on it.

todos.title: TRADEMARK INFRINGEMENT POSSIBLE ELEMENTS
todos.body: Strength of the plaintiffs trademark.  Degree of similarity between the two marks at issue.  Similarity of the goods and services at issue.  Evidence of actual confusion.  Purchaser sophistication.  Quality of the defendants goods or services.  Whether the defendants attempt to register the trademark was bona fide (in good faith).

todos.title: DON'T STEP ON OTHER PEOPLE'S TOES
todos.body: Research to see who else is using the name and if they are in the same vertical markets as you are.

todos.title: USE YOUR GUT
todos.body: Names should be designed to last longer than there founders.  If it doesn't sound right or is too fashionable, go back to the drawing board.

todos.title: CELLPHONE TEST
todos.body: Must be able to clearly communicate name over a broken cell phone call.

todos.title: ORGANIC
todos.body: Keep it organic.  Build strong roots.  Focus on the impact you can make, not the name.

todos.title: PLACES TO CHECK AVAILABILITY
todos.body: Delaware Secretary of State, Nebraska Secretary of State, AppStores, Domain Name Registrar, Twitter Handle

todos.title: Oppenheimer Rule
todos.body: People have a greater affection for words and names that are easier to pronounce.
